trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Mobile Services for PhoneGap/cordova apps
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Mobile Services for PhoneGap/cordova apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for PhoneGap development for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for PhoneGap development for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: Additional Requirements
trans-unit.target: Additional Requirements

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: PhoneGap tools (v3.2+ required for Windows Phone 8 projects).
trans-unit.target: PhoneGap tools (v3.2+ required for Windows Phone 8 projects).

trans-unit.source: An active Microsoft Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Microsoft Azure account.

trans-unit.source: PhoneGap supports developing for multiple platforms.
trans-unit.target: PhoneGap supports developing for multiple platforms.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the PhoneGap tools themselves, you must install the tools for each platform you are targeting:
trans-unit.target: In addition to the PhoneGap tools themselves, you must install the tools for each platform you are targeting:

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone: Install [Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=268374)
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone: Install [Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=268374)

trans-unit.source: iOS: Install [Xcode] (v4.4+ required)
trans-unit.target: iOS: Install [Xcode] (v4.4+ required)

trans-unit.source: Android: Install the [Android Developer Tools][Android SDK]
trans-unit.target: Android: Install the [Android Developer Tools][Android SDK]

trans-unit.source: (The Mobile Services SDK for Android supports apps for Android 2.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: (The Mobile Services SDK for Android supports apps for Android 2.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: Android 4.2 or higher is required to run the quick start app.)
trans-unit.target: Android 4.2 or higher is required to run the quick start app.)

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Create a new PhoneGap app
trans-unit.target: Create a new PhoneGap app

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new PhoneGap app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new PhoneGap app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click **Mobile Services**, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click **PhoneGap** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new PhoneGap app**.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click **PhoneGap** under **Choose platform** and expand **Create a new PhoneGap app**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create a PhoneGap app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create a PhoneGap app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, download and install PhoneGap and at least one of the platform development tools (Windows Phone, iOS, or Android).
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, download and install PhoneGap and at least one of the platform development tools (Windows Phone, iOS, or Android).

trans-unit.source: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create TodoItem table** to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under **Download and run your app**, click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Download and run your app**, click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services JavaScript SDK.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services JavaScript SDK.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: Run your new PhoneGap app
trans-unit.target: Run your new PhoneGap app

trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open and run the project according to the instructions below for each platform.
trans-unit.target: Open and run the project according to the instructions below for each platform.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8: Open the .sln file in the **platforms\wp8** folder in Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8: Open the .sln file in the **platforms\wp8** folder in Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to rebuild the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to rebuild the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: Open the project in the **platforms/ios** folder in Xcode.
trans-unit.target: Open the project in the **platforms/ios** folder in Xcode.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator, which is the default for this project.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to build the project and start the app in the iPhone emulator, which is the default for this project.

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, click **File** then **Import**, expand **Android**, click **Existing Android Code into Workspace**, and then click **Next.**
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, click **File** then **Import**, expand **Android**, click **Existing Android Code into Workspace**, and then click **Next.**

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse**, browse to the location of the expanded project files, click **OK**, make sure that the TodoActivity project is checked, then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse**, browse to the location of the expanded project files, click **OK**, make sure that the TodoActivity project is checked, then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: This imports the project files into the current workspace.
trans-unit.target: This imports the project files into the current workspace.

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Run** to start the project in the Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Run** to start the project in the Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To be able to run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To be able to run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).

trans-unit.source: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.

trans-unit.source: After launching the app in one of the mobile emulators above, type some text into the textbox and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: After launching the app in one of the mobile emulators above, type some text into the textbox and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the **TodoItem** table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the **TodoItem** table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Changes to this platform project will be overwritten if the main project is rebuilt with the PhoneGap tools.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Changes to this platform project will be overwritten if the main project is rebuilt with the PhoneGap tools.

trans-unit.source: Instead, make changes in the project's root www directory as outlined in the section below.
trans-unit.target: Instead, make changes in the project's root www directory as outlined in the section below.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Management Portal, click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItem** table.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Management Portal, click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItem** table.

trans-unit.source: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.

trans-unit.source: Make app updates and rebuild projects for each platform
trans-unit.target: Make app updates and rebuild projects for each platform

trans-unit.source: Make changes to code files in the ´www´ directory, which in this case is ´todolist/www´.
trans-unit.target: Make changes to code files in the ´www´ directory, which in this case is ´todolist/www´.

trans-unit.source: Verify that all of the target platform tools are accessible in the system path.
trans-unit.target: Verify that all of the target platform tools are accessible in the system path.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt in the root project directory, and run one of the following platform-specific commands:
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt in the root project directory, and run one of the following platform-specific commands:

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone

trans-unit.source: Run the following command from the Visual Studio Developer command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command from the Visual Studio Developer command prompt:

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: Open terminal and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: Open terminal and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt or terminal window and run the following command.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt or terminal window and run the following command.

trans-unit.source: Open each project in the appropriate development environment as outlined in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: Open each project in the appropriate development environment as outlined in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the js/index.js file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the js/index.js file.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: [Add push notifications to your app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/magazine/dn879353.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [Add push notifications to your app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/magazine/dn879353.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to register for and send push notifications to your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to register for and send push notifications to your app.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
